page.title: 13WETHERBY - SOCIAL TRENDS
page.content: In June 1985 Wetherby High, St.James Junior, and Crossley Street Junior Schools surveyed social trends. The results confirmed the social divisions shown in the 1981 Census.The results of the survey were:- -average family size was 4.3 persons, -84% of pupils lived in Wetherby, -81% of working parents worked locally, -the average house has 3.6 bedrooms (58% had 4 or more bedrooms), (88% were owner occupied), -the average number of cars was 1.5 (49% had more than 2 per household), -95% of households had a freezer, 100% a colour T.V., 57% a video recorder, 63% a computer and 100% a telephone, -42% holidayed in the U.K., 32% in the E.E.C., 8% elsewhere overseas and 18% locally.
